choices: Information when dealing with the machine
questions.answer: Information when dealing with the machine
questions.explanation: Data is information when dealing with the machine and it is in a raw form.
questions.hint: Think about the form of data before it is processed.
questions.mascot: Data is the raw information we use in computing!

choices: Any knowledge that comes to our attention
questions.explanation: Information is any knowledge that comes to our attention and it is processed data.
questions.hint: Think about what data becomes after it is processed.
questions.mascot: Information is processed data that can be understood and used!

questions.questionText: What are the four basic operations of the information-processing cycle?
questions.explanation: The information-processing cycle consists of four basic operations: input, processing, output, and storage.
questions.hint: Think about the steps taken from entering data to storing it.
questions.mascot: Remember, data goes through a cycle of input, processing, output, and storage!
